@SidDegen community members can also create value within or bring value from outside (like Superteam GDP)

Play to your strengths: â€¢ If you have tech chops, build first. â€¢ If you can rally people, start with community. â€¢ If you have network & credibility, raise first. A great exercise would be: - Draw out these three arrows (Tech, Community, Capital). - Write a short para on yourâ€¦

Successful web3 startups have prioritized each pillar in different orders: â€¢ Tech-first â†’ Build product â†’ Raise money â†’ Find users â€¢ Community-first â†’ Build hype â†’ Raise money â†’ Ship product â€¢ Capital-first â†’ Raise â†’ Hire â†’ Build Which should you choose?

Look at FWB & CabinDAO. They built a community first, then raised funds, and now theyâ€™re building tech with a built-in user base. Community = early adopters, beta testers, BD, content, contributors, and investors. Though, thereâ€™s no â€œone right way.â€ (PS: Join our Foundersâ€¦
Most founders think thereâ€™s only one way to build a startup: 1. Build an MVP 2. Raise funds 3. Acquire users But in web3, you can do these in any order.
